title: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
description: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
OB: When attempting to rename a package in the software, if one or more resources within the package are read-only, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed after the rename operation is completed.
EB: The software should have a precondition check before renaming a package to ensure that all resources within the package are writeable. If any resource is read-only, the user should be notified and prevented from proceeding with the rename operation.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the software and create a new package.
2. Inside the package, create a compilation unit (CU) file.
3. Set the permissions of the CU file to read-only.
4. Attempt to rename the package.
5. Observe that after the rename operation finishes, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed.
